This disparity may create challenges and potential conflicts within the team dynamics and expectations.

Opportunities for home-schoolers: Instead of focusing on integrating into high school teams, it may be more beneficial for home-schoolers to have separate athletic opportunities within their own home-schooling communities. This would allow them to compete amongst peers who have similar academic experiences, fostering a more supportive and inclusive environment.

In conclusion, while it is important to address prejudices and provide equal opportunities for all students, the integration of home-schoolers into high school teams may not be the most appropriate solution. Considering the potential challenges faced by home-schoolers and the impact on the team dynamics, it is more reasonable to explore alternative avenues for home-schooled students to participate in sports.
